intro: Goniophlebium neriifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf fern, is a species of fern characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically divided into numerous segments. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with the rhizomes often covered in a dense mat of roots. Its fronds are usually evergreen, providing a lush appearance throughout the growing season. The spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in humid environments.
